= Motion in a Plane =

== TL;DR ==

*Motion of a projectile (parabolic trajectory)*
{{$
\begin{align}
  v_x &= v_{0x} = v_0\cos{\theta} \\
  v_y &= v_{0y} - gt = v_0\sin{\theta} - gt \\
  x &= v_{0x}t \\
  y &= v_{0y}t - \frac{1}{2}gt^2
\end{align}
}}$
*Centripetal acceleration of uniform circular motion*
{{$
a = \frac{v^2}{r}
}}$

== Components of Velocity and Acceleration ==

Speed

Magnitude

{{$
v = \sqrt{v_x^2 + v_y^2}
}}$

Components

{{$
v_x = v \mathrm{cos}\theta
}}$

{{$
v_y = v \mathrm{sin}\theta
}}$

== The Motion of Projectiles ==

Horizontal Motion

{{$
v_x = v_{0x}
}}$

{{$
x = v_{0x}t
}}$

Vertical Motion

{{$
v_y = v_{0y} - gt
}}$

{{$
y = v_{0y}t - \frac{1}{2}gt^2
}}$

== Uniform Circular Motion ==

Angular Velocity

{{$
\omega = \frac{v}{r}
}}$

{{$
\omega = \frac{\theta}{t}
}}$

{{$
\omega = \frac{2\pi}{T}
}}$

Centripetal acceleration

{{$
a = \frac{v^2}{r}
}}$

{{$
a = \frac{(\omega r)^2}{r} = \omega^2 r
}}$
